channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Two Powerful U.S. Allies Came to Blows in Yemen
item.description: Tensions between Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates burst into the open this week with an unusually direct confrontation that has global implic...

item.title: Feds are hunting teenage hacking groups like ‘Scattered Spider’ who have targeted $1 trillion worth of the Fortune 500 since 2022
item.description: Rogue teens have attacked some 120 companies—including Nike, Chick-fil-A, Instacart, and News Corporation—often posing as IT staff.

item.title: Mayor Mamdani Appoints a Team of Government Veterans
item.description: Zohran Mamdani has stocked his administration with seasoned officials, in part to allay concerns about his inexperience and left-wing stances.

item.title: Threat to Suspend Aid for Minnesota Child-Care Centers Rattles Families
item.description: After the federal government threatened to withhold funds for Minnesota’s child-care program, citing fraud concerns, parents and providers warned that...

item.title: Crans-Montana is a Historic Swiss Ski Resort Popular with International Tourists
item.description: Known for its gourmet food, luxury stores, and for hosting major sporting events, the high-end resort was acquired by Vail Resorts in 2024.

item.title: Negative prices for electricity are getting more common in Europe and consumer costs have dipped—while Americans face rising energy bills
item.description: By September, the number of hours in Spain with negative prices had already topped 500 for the year to date, more than double the full-year total for ...

item.title: CEOs say they are unplugging from the top job by cancelling all meetings and playing with Legos over the holidays
item.description: The leaders behind tech companies and multimillion-dollar cookie empires weigh in on work-life balance during the holidays—from strict screen time lim...

item.title: Mark Cuban says he doesn’t do calls and prefers email because ‘if we do it by phone, I’m going to forget half the stuff that we talked about’
item.description: Meanwhile, Gen Zers prefer email or text because of their anxiety about talking on the phone.

item.title: It’s New Year’s Day 2026. What’s open and closed?
item.description: Most federal services are shuttered, but the retail landscape remains mixed.

item.title: Crans-Montana Bar Fire Victims Transported Across Switzerland for Treatment
item.description: Patients were taken by helicopter and jet to bigger, specialized hospitals in Geneva, Zurich and Lausanne.

item.title: Live Updates: Dozens Believed Dead After Fire at New Year’s Party in Switzerland, Police Say
item.description: The fire broke out around 1:30 a.m. local time at a bar at the Crans-Montana ski resort. Roughly 100 people were also injured in the overnight blaze, ...
